snippet: The Buncombe County register of deeds said that he would accept marriage license applications from same-sex couples and seek an opinion from the state attorney general.
abstract: Drew Reisinger, Bencombe County register of deeds, says he will accept marriage license applications from same-sec couples in North Carolina and seek opinion from state attorney general Roy Cooper; says 2012 amendment has forced him to deny licenses to 'upstanding citizens' and he feels it is unfair.
lead_paragraph: The Buncombe County register of deeds said that he would accept marriage license applications from same-sex couples and seek an opinion from the state attorney general.

headline.main: North Carolina: Marriage Ban Is Challenged
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Marriage Ban Is Challenged

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
